page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: The area is part of the Vale of Glamorgan. The Vale is a rich, rolling agricultural area used for both pastoral & arable farming. It is well known in South Wales for its attractive countryside, & attracts many visitors to its pubs & restaurants. The most important town in the Vale is Cowbridge, an ancient borough which is believed to have Roman origins. There is no industry in the block studied by Cowbridge school.The settlements are for the main part dormitory villages which have late Medieval origins.Most are attractive and well kept, though often difficult to get to because the roads are narrow and winding.{ { {
